intro: Galium ruthenicum f. setulosum, commonly known as the hairy wood-sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitats.
